I don't think it'll ever get off the ground, but if it did it would have to be monitored by specified personnel or a game warden. Can you imagine some lazy ne'er-do-well shooting at whatever walked out in front of him/her? Just, point, click, kill. No hunting to it.
 And what about other countries, unregulated, opening these up? You could shoot a lion in Africa for a few thousand, email your kill to some poor guy on standby there, then point, click and kill in some other exotic place. Can't pass up that kind of money, now can they? 
 
 These guys could open a franchise...Whoopeeee~~!
 
 On the other hand, this would be a very interesting legal situation if someone wandered into that area and was shot. With all of the identity theft, could you prove who did the shooting? Maybe - but who is liable?
